newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank to brief media on sale of TV Asahi shares.
newsitem.headline: Softbank to brief media on sale of TV Asahi shares.

text.p: Softbank Corp said on Monday it would brief the media at 5 p.m. (0800 GMT) on the sale of its shares in Asahi National Broadcasting Co (TV Asahi).

In June 1996, Softbank and its digital satellite TV ally News Corp of Australia jointly bought 21.4 percent of Japanese nationwide TV network Asahi National Broadcasting of Japan (TV Asahi), becoming one of its biggest shareholders.
Softbank and News Corp at that time bought the shares for 41.75 billion yen through their equally owned joint venture.
Softbank's investment amounted to 20.88 billion yen, the company said.
The two firms have a established digital satellite broadcasting company, Japan Sky Broadcasting (JSkyB), which will start beaming 12 channels in Japan in April.
